revised_title: Rate Coefficient of Three-Body Ion-Neutral Association: Accounting for Orbital Angular Momentum
tldr: The authors studied the process of three-body ion-neutral association, where atomic ions convert into molecular ions. They developed a quasi-equilibrium statistical theory to calculate the rate coefficient, taking into account the orbital angular momentum of the associating pair. The theory predicts a rate coefficient that is in good agreement with experimental measurements, indicating the importance of considering orbital angular momentum in these processes.
